intro: Verbesina chihuahuensis, commonly known as the Chihuahua ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico and the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soils, making it well adapted to semi-desert environments. Verbesina chihuahuensis is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
